column4: My Production serer of 11.10 is running great. Should I upgrade to 12?
No I do not.
And for my call center this server is critical because the call center software stores all the dispositioned leads here.
So when the client wants to make sure the Agent is doing their job, they can connect and download.
I am I.T. for a Telemarketing firm. :)
is also the master of wisdom.
Yes, that is a good reason.
Hahaha, my employer does not care what I do. He buys toys and gives me an idea of what he wants and then I facilitate that.
I'm working in an environment where they care selectively. THey care more when a client has a concern of compliance, so I'm left making decisions based on that.
I hear ya.

What are you usign Ubuntu workstations for? For instance, the Agents in this office, 60 total, have to use a Java based client to connect to there call center software. So I could see ubuntu being a great workstation. What do your  users do?
I'm advocating Ubuntu to cut cost in M$ licensing. Most of my testing is the systems on my desk at this point.
Ahhh. :D
I'm "that guy" in the IT dept. The 15 year linux guy who had to pick a windows sysmin profession.
Yes all the machines here run Xp, with a Win Server 2008 running AD DHCP and DNS.
Same here. :)
yea we're running the works on the M$ side. And they're impressed with how well my open source alternatives are working out. I'm the only person running linux as my primary workstation.
That is awesome!
My only small victory at the moment is our File server I have rocking Ubuntu. ;)
we had a very mixed environment on the nix side before I came onboard. BSD, Solaris, Debian, Cent & SUSE. Consolidated that. Easier to script.
Ubuntu has solved lots of problems for me.
Jesus!
and for the company.
Well that is an awesome testimony. Should be on the front page.
